topic.title: PHY <-> FlexE <-> MAC <-> OTN Datapaths

li.p: 10-100G clients demuliplexed from FlexE going through Ethernet MAC and adapted for GFP Clause 6.2 mapping into OTN without preamble (10).

fig.title: PHY <-> FlexE <-> MAC to OTN Datapaths

body.p: On the receive path, the different 100GE PHYs of a FlexE Group comes from SERDES and then go through the PHY RX blocks that performs the PMA, FEC and PCS functions. The traffic goes to the FLEX_DEMUX which terminates the FLexE Group and extract the FlexE clients. The traffic then pass through the MAC that delineate Ethernet packets, deleting all idles and O/S. These packets are forwarded and stored into the ECPB packet buffer. The MAC provides full PMON while the FEPP_I provides packet insertion and extraction capabilities. The MAPOTN extract these packets and perform the GFP map.

On the transmit path, the MAPOTN takes the GFP packets and stored them into the ECPB. The FEDP forward these packets to a transmit MAC that adds the preamble, idles and O/S. The MAC_TX provides full PMON while the FEPP_E provides packet insertion and extraction capabilities. The FLEXE_MUX mutliplex these clients into a Flex group. The PHY rate information (usually nominal) is given to the SERDES outside the ENET subsystem. The SERDES then backpressure the TX PHY and the FLEXE_MUX

draft-comment.author: hookerje
draft-comment.i: [DDD/HWS] SW/Apps to add API and datapath segment configuration content here.
